citations.narrative:
Records showing the date the deer are received or when offspring are born and where they are coming from are not
being kept for the deer. Not documenting the required acquisition information for the deer doesn't allow for the proper
tracking of the animals by APHIS officials. All acquisition information must be documented for all regulated animals.

The licensee does not have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan in place doesn't ensure the
animals will be taken care of in times of an emergency or natural disaster. The licensee must get a contingency plan put
in place. Correct by 9/17/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records showing the date the deer are received or when offspring are born and where they are coming from are not 
being kept for the deer. Not documenting the required acquisition information for the deer doesn't allow for the proper 
tracking of the animals by APHIS officials. All acquisition information must be documented for all regulated animals. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee does not have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan in place doesn't ensure the 
animals will be taken care of in times of an emergency or natural disaster. The licensee must get a contingency plan put 
in place. Correct by 9/17/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
